Is it reproduceable? Any helpful test case? Thanks.

the 2.1.0 final release (200303272130)

I started implementing a debug model from scratch. Currently there is only a 
LaunchConfigurationDelegate that does nothing except some output to System.out 
and attaching my created implementation of the IDebugTarget.

It occured only one time after a successfully launch. The debug target was 
visible and I could successfully diconnect/terminate the launched "dummy".

My implementation of IDebugTarget does nothing except allowing disconnecting 
and not allowing terminating, suspending and resuming. DebugEvents a through 
like inside the JDT debug model.

It is not reproducable, thus I expected that I missed something in my 
implementation. Although it might be a bug? My implementation of IDebugTarget 
returns false in #hasThreads() and null in getThreads(). That might cause this 
NPE.

Gunnar, the API on IDebugTarget does not allow you to return null for 
getThreads(). It says that you have to return an empty array.
